title: Australia news live: NSW police used capsicum spray to subdue 87-year-old at Sydney nursing home
summary: Please provide the news article or details you would like summarized, and I will help you with that!

title: NSW police use capsicum spray to subdue 87-year-old man in Sydney nursing home
summary: Police have arrested a man who allegedly threatened to harm himself and other residents while wielding a metal object. The incident raised concerns for safety in the community. Authorities are investigating the matter further.

title: ACT police accused of ‘racial profiling’ for allegedly pulling guns on Indigenous teenager after mistaking him for suspect
summary: The family of a 17-year-old boy on a bus that was halted by police claims that officers conducted a search of the teen despite acknowledging they had made a mistake in stopping the vehicle. They are questioning the legality of the search and the officers' conduct. The incident has raised concerns about police practices and accountability.

title: Angoulême comics festival in crisis as creators and publishers declare boycott
summary: The French government has retracted funding from an organization following allegations of toxic management and the dismissal of an employee who filed a rape complaint. This decision underscores the state's commitment to addressing issues of workplace harassment and protection for whistleblowers. The situation highlights the need for accountability and support for victims in institutional settings.

title: Nazi bombs, torpedo heads and mines: how marine life thrives on dumped weapons
summary: Scientists have found thousands of sea creatures living among abandoned World War II munitions off the German coast. This unexpected ecosystem highlights the complex relationship between marine life and human-made debris. The discovery raises questions about the environmental impact of such ordnance on marine habitats.
